cluster_relations.rel_desc: Pollination involves the transfer of pollen.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Flowering plant reproductive structures and organisms

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Pollen is moved from one flower to another flower.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Flowering plant reproductive structures and organisms
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Flowering plant reproductive structures and organisms
remarks: Relation name kept generic but directional; subject is transferred entity, object is location.

args.canonical_rel_desc: The process includes the transfer of the specified substance as a constitutive step.
args.justification: The subject is a biological process (pollination) and the object is the substance being moved (pollen); the relation expresses that the process is constituted by transfer of this substance, not merely that it happens to co-occur.

args.canonical_rel_desc: The subject entity is transferred between instances of the object entity type (treated as source and target locations) during a process.
args.justification: The subject is the transferred entity (pollen) and the object is the type of locations (flowers) between which it moves; this is best modeled as a transfer/movement relation between locations rather than process composition.
args.remark: Object represents the class of locations (flowers) between which the subject is transferred; specific source/target can be expressed via qualifiers or reified events if needed.

args.justification: Pollination involving transfer of pollen describes a constitutive component of the process (a key subprocess/material-transfer step), fitting a process–component relation family.
The relation captures that a material entity (pollen) is moved between locations of a given type (flowers), which is a canonical material transfer/movement pattern.
The relation specifies what the process of pollination is composed of (it includes a transfer-of-pollen step), aligning with process composition semantics.
The core meaning is spatial movement of pollen between instances of flowers, i.e., transfer across locations, which fits a broad spatial/movement grouping.
